benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/search - Search custom fields by type, name and optional value

covered: Valid Request: Many positive scenarios (TC01-TC12, TC17, TC27, TC37) exercise valid combinations of query parameters including objectType, fieldName, fieldValue and combinations thereof.
Empty Response: TC11 and TC28 explicitly test empty-result cases and behavior when DB has no matching/custom fields.
Pagination: TC07, TC21 and TC22 exercise offset/limit and edge cases (large limit, offset beyond data set). Performance/scale tests (TC30, TC31) also exercise pagination under load.

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of valid/invalid query params, including combined filters (TC05, TC06), unexpected params (TC12), and many invalid-input cases (TC13, TC14, TC15, TC16, TC19, TC20).
Authorization: TC17 covers authentication failure (missing/invalid auth) and expected 401 behavior.
Audit Handling: TC08, TC09, TC10, TC32 and TC33 cover audit level parameter behavior, integration with audit service, and degraded service scenarios; TC26 addresses regression for audit=FULL.
Error Handling and Messages: Many error scenarios (TC13-TC16, TC19-TC20) plus TC35 covering descriptive error messages and structure.
Resilience/Recovery and Concurrency: TC23 (concurrent requests), TC24 (DB under heavy load), and TC36 (transient network recovery) cover concurrency and resilience aspects.
Regression and Backward Compatibility: TC25 and TC27 cover regression and backward compatibility concerns.
Performance: TC30, TC31 and TC24 define response-time expectations under normal and peak/loaded conditions.
Integration and State Variations: TC32, TC33, TC28, TC29 cover integration verification and different DB states (empty/partial).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No explicit tests for rate limiting/throttling behavior (e.g., 429 responses when too many requests are sent in short succession).
Caching Behavior: No scenarios validate caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional requests (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Authorization Variants: While missing-auth is covered (TC17), there is no explicit test for insufficient permissions (403) or token expiry scenarios that differ from unauthenticated requests.

Pagination metadata and determinism: Tests exercise offset/limit slices but do not validate pagination metadata (if present) such as total counts, next/prev links, or deterministic ordering of results across pages.
Rate/Load safety for very large limits: TC21 tests limit=1000, but there is no test for server-enforced maximum limit or behaviour when limit exceeds configured max (e.g., enforced cap or 4xx/422).
Input encoding and internationalization: No tests for non-ASCII/unicode characters in fieldName/fieldValue which can affect searching/encoding.
Cache invalidation on data change: No tests verifying cache behavior when custom fields change (stale data handling).
Authorization header variations: No tests for malformed auth headers or multiple auth schemes.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to ensure 429 or documented behavior is returned and that throttling headers (Retry-After) are present when applicable.

Add caching/conditional request tests: verify ETag/Cache-Control/Last-Modified headers are present if supported; exercise If-None-Match and expect 304 when appropriate; validate cache behavior after updates (stale data scenarios).
Add permission/403 tests and token-expiry scenarios: cover authenticated but unauthorized clients, expired tokens, and malformed auth headers.
Add pagination metadata and ordering tests: if API provides total count or links, validate those; also assert deterministic ordering across pages (sort order) so pagination slices are stable.
Test server-enforced limits: add tests for limit > allowed maximum and define expected behavior (cap vs error).
Add unicode and encoding tests: exercise queries with non-ASCII characters and percent-encoding to ensure correct matching and error handling.
Add tests for cache invalidation when custom fields change (PUT/DELETE flows in integration tests) to ensure clients do not get stale data.
Clarify and add tests for documented error codes: e.g., whether invalid params should return 400 vs 422 and standardize messages; add tests to assert error response schema (code/message/details).
